intro: Melpomene zempoaltepetlensis, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a species native to the highlands of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers. The plant produces striking red or orange flowers that are often adorned with contrasting markings. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, typical of many species in the family. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
